pullRequest.title: LRA participant feature and fat tests

commit.message: LRA participant feature and fat tests

nodes.bodyText: Since when does N come after R in the alphabet?
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText:
I think the maven version should be just 1.0-M1
https://repo1.maven.org/maven2/org/eclipse/microprofile/lra/microprofile-lra-api/1.0-M1/microprofile-lra-api-1.0-M1.jar
... but you could change that in a follow up PR

nodes.bodyText: This file is named incorrectly and the copyright date should probably be 2020?
I'm not sure that this error message is required since FFDC will automatically added. If it is needed then it should be NLS enabled.
is MP Config 1.3 correct? Shouldn't it be at least 1.4?

nodes.bodyText: Again, there will be an FFDC automatically added here to log the URISyntaxException. You then rethrow with a NLS enabled message. I don't think you need the extra error trace ... which would need to be NLS enabled anyway.

commit.message:
Reduce name length in metatype.properties

As there was an error in the build otherwise

afterCommit.message:
Reduce name length in metatype.properties

As there was an error in the build otherwise

commit.message: Removing com.ibm.ws.require.java8 as no longer required

Add the always passes test

As the real tests are currently experimental, and you need
a passing test in every fat bucket

nodes.bodyText: Add "file." to the end of the useraction so that it has "Correct the LRA coordinator configuration in the server.xml file."

nodes.bodyText:
The info log level doesn't count as trace so it shouldn't be behind an isAnyTracingEnabled() guard and it needs to be translated.
Can be done as a follow up action.

This file appears to be unnecessary.
Can be done as a follow up action.

nodes.bodyText:
FYI,  you don't need to list features here which are in your server xml.
tested.features is to tell the build infrastructure that your test uses additional features not listed in server.xml (usually through @RepeatTests)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+javac.source: 1.8
+javac.target: 1.8
+
+src: \
+	fat/src
+
+fat.project: true
+
+tested.features: mpLRA-1.0

nodes.bodyText: Stray comment

This is one place to define a trace group which the user can use to turn on trace for the whole feature rather than having to list package and class names. Elsewhere, you've used LRA as the tracegroup
I don't think you want this in the API bundle anyway since it won't have trace in it.

+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/rejar.props
+
+bVersion=1.0
+
+javac.source: 1.8
+javac.target: 1.8
+
+Bundle-SymbolicName: io.openliberty.org.eclipse.microprofile.lra.1.0; singleton:=true
+                     
+Require-Capability: osgi.ee;filter:="(&(osgi.ee=JavaSE)(version=1.8))"
+
+# We will whittle this down once it is working
+Export-Package: \
+  org.eclipse.microprofile.lra*; version="1.0.0"
+
+# TODO what should this be?
+#WS-TraceGroup: REACTIVESTREAMS

nodes.bodyText: I don't think it would help to declare a trace group for this bundle since trace groups unfortunately don't work for third party code.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@

+  io.narayana.lra; version=5.10.5

+# TODO what should this be?

nodes.bodyText: Do you have an issue open to whittle these lists down?
nodes.diffHunk:
